thread.title: Partners bring valuable programs to Ames Public Library
thread.title_full: Partners bring valuable programs to Ames Public Library

title: Partners bring valuable programs to Ames Public Library
text:
Partners bring valuable programs to Ames Public Library By Mary LogsdonAmes Public Library 
If you are looking for an opportunity to make an informed decision about health care, learn essential job readiness skills or consider mortality, you need look no further than Ames Public Library (APL) in November. 
Thanks to local and state partner organizations, Iowa State University Extension and Outreach, Iowa Workforce Development and Mary Greeley Medical Center, experts in their field will lead programs on these subjects. 
Barb Wollan, human sciences specialist, family finance, Iowa State University Extension and Outreach, will present Smart Choice Health Insurance, a two-hour workshop from 10 a.m. to noon on Saturday Nov. 7. This workshop will help you understand health insurance terms and concepts, think about health care needs and priorities and give you an opportunity to review key provisions of the Affordable Care Act. This is, of course, relevant as the enrollment period for the 2016 Health Insurance Marketplace begins on Nov. 1. Whether this information would help you, a friend, a family member or someone you employ, you are sure to come away with a greater understanding of how to evaluate available choices. This program is made possible by funding from a U.S. Department of Health and Human Services grant. 
APL is partnering with Iowa Workforce Development to offer three days of workforce readiness training on Fridays in November led by a professional training team from IowaWORKS — Central Iowa. Each day will be divided between a morning informational session on a particular topic from 10 a.m. to noon, followed by two hours of hands-on training in resume writing from 1 to 3 p.m. 
Please note the following schedule details: 
n Nov. 6, Resume Basics — Learn techniques to create a great resume that will help you get the interview for the job you want. 
n Nov. 13, Online applications — So many jobs today require online applications. Learn the best tricks for completing these applications, attaching and downloading electronic files and taking online assessment tests. 
n Nov. 20, Interviewing — Learn how to interview well and negotiate effectively for a better salary. 
Registration is recommended, but not required, for the Smart Choice Health Insurance workshop and the job training programs. Please call the library at (515) 239-5646, and choose 4 for Adult Services and Reference, to reserve a spot. 
Also in November, APL is partnering with Mary Greeley Medical Center to offer On Mortality, a series of presentations and discussions about end-of-life issues at 7 p.m. each Monday. Again, please mark your calendar to attend the following programs: 
n Nov. 2, Faith and Traditions — Christopher Chase, senior lecturer in the Iowa State University department of philosophy and religious studies, will moderate a panel discussion with representatives of several faith traditions and “nones.” 
n Nov. 9, Tools for Caregivers — Jolene Philo, author of “The Caregiver’s Notebook,” will give tips for caregivers including how to create emergency packets, fill out medication lists and tame the paperwork that accompanies the responsibility for caring for a loved one. 
n Nov. 16 — Grief and the Holidays. Mary Greeley Medical Center Hospice Bereavement Coordinator Bonnie Riphagen will talk about how the loss of a loved may affect you during the holidays. 
n Nov. 23, The Practical Side — representatives from Mary Greeley Medical Center Hospice, Adams Funeral Home, and Nyemaster Goode PC will talk about practical issues related to the end of life and address common questions that occur when someone dies. 
n Nov. 30, Palliative Care — Joni Williams, palliative care coordinator at Mary Greeley Medical Center, will address palliative care, including how it differs from hospice. Partner organizations from within our local and state community enrich library programming. 
Look closely at all of the details related to these and other programs in November by checking our website, Facebook page or by picking up a copy of Page One. You may also sign up to receive Page One in your email if you prefer. And, by all means, stop by the Adult Services desk where we are always happy to assist you. Rules for posting comments
